quest.name: Groping in the Dark
journal: Estinien looks at you with his piercing gaze.
objectives: Gather information on the hydromantic terraces.
Speak with Varshahn in the Seat of the Foremost.
Speak with Zero on the hydromantic terraces.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: From memoria to Golbez and his archfiends, we have more questions now than answers. But that is a sign that we are making progress.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: If Golbez has Azdaja at his mercy, then we must find him. Hopefully Zero has knowledge that will aid us in our search...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: There is nothing like the aether of a living mortal. I haven't felt so satisfied since my return.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hmm... Forename, you've come to the Thirteenth before, yes? You fought voidsent here.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But clearly you didn't know they could regenerate, else you would have shared that detail beforehand.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: They seemed to stay dead at the time, yes.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I was in a bit of a rush and didn't have time to wait around and see...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I doubt not that they did. There must be a reason why the ones you defeated did not return, in contravention of the natural order.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Do you remember aught out of the ordinary? A sealing magick like Zero's, perhaps?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: From what I know of your foray, I can hardly blame you.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps they returned after you left. But if they didn't, there must be a reason why.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: There are circumstances in which we're unable to return. If you like, I can tell you about this.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Please do.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: The more you devour, the more powerful you grow. But in the process, your essence is blended with those of your prey.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: If you were to lose your flesh, the souls you had come to harbor may break free and coalesce into distinct voidsent once more.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: And before you yourself return, your own soul might be devoured by your enemies or your erstwhile prey. A fate more likely for stronger beings, who require more time to regenerate.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: However, even assuming you survive the process, it's highly uncommon to return as you were.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Yet despite his greater strength, Scarmiglione managed to resurrect rather swiftly. Are there others capable of the same?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Not that I'm aware of. His attachment to his flesh must've been unique for him to develop such an ability.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I believe we understand the fundamentals of rebirth now.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If I may, I would ask you about your power. Will you tell us about it?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: What you saw should speak for itself. I can bind the aether of the soul in crystal.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Many wielded this power during the Contramemoria, but I'm the only one left.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am told that heroes of the Thirteenth once sealed gods in stones called auracite. Are they and memoria one and the same?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: “Auracite”... I do not know this word, but the world is vast, and perhaps memoria had different names elsewhere. But it does sound quite similar.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: How does one come to wield memoria? And what happened to your peers?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Hm, I've never thought about that... I do know, though, that voidsent can't use the power. I assume I can because I'm mortal in part.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...I see.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Zero, I wish to ask you about the man called Golbez.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: He may well have my sister in his clutches. Is there aught you can tell us of him?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: The name sounds vaguely familiar, though I can't say how I know it.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: If he is powerful, however, someone in the castle may have heard of him.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Then we must try talking to the other voidsent again!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let us entrust the task to Forename. HerHis Echo will help facilitate communication.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: More importantly, shehe should be able to maintain herhis composure better than a concerned sibling.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: That, I cannot deny...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but will you not ask about Golbez in my stead? On the terraces to begin with, perhaps.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Thank you. We shall remain here and discuss what other avenues we might pursue in the meantime.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Scarmiglione, too, appeared surprised by Zero's power. As she says, it must be a lost art.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This makes her invaluable to our cause─far more than someone who can simply communicate.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I know what it feels like to have my essence blended with that of another.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Yet tumultuous though it was, it was only one wyrm's soul. To be bound to scores of others over thousands of years sounds horrible.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: According to your vision, Golbez recruited his champions and raised an army by offering a dragon's aether in exchange.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Whatever his crusade, 'tis unconscionable to use a dragon's life force as fodder. He will answer for his deeds.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: So with this “Echo” of yours, you can see into the past? Interesting.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Those memories may as well be all that remains of it, though. Everything and everyone was warped by Darkness. However storied it may appear, this castle is simply the product of its mistress's mind.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593B
dialogue.text: Ugh, the tasty one returns to tempt me. I mustn't eat you, I mustn't eat you...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593B
dialogue.text: ...Golbez? I know of him from those I've eaten.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593B
dialogue.text: He has minions. And those minions have minions. No one ever sees him.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With his army of minions, Golbez would seldom have need to act personally. It will not be easy to reach him.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593B
dialogue.text: Golbez must be strong. Very strong. If I were you, I wouldn't try to eat him.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593C
dialogue.text: If the one who devoured her dies, perhaps the mistress will return. Then I may bask in her gaze again...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593C
dialogue.text: G-Golbez, you say!? My mistress spoke of him!

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593C
dialogue.text: He commands the archfiends! They are very powerful and have conquered many domains!

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593C
dialogue.text: The mistress bade us defend the castle from them. Yes, yes, she did!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems the archfiends have been attacking other domains. Their fearsome reputation precedes them.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593C
dialogue.text: I'll defend the castle from the archfiends. And when the mistress returns, perhaps she'll favor me with a long gaze...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593D
dialogue.text: So the clever one hadn't been eaten? If no one wants it, then perhaps...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593D
dialogue.text: Golbez? Of course I know of him. Only a fool without ears wouldn't.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593D
dialogue.text: His archfiends lead armies to ravage and conquer. They devour those they deem useless. Those who can't fight.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593D
dialogue.text: If you don't want to be eaten, then you had better flee. Though soon there will be nowhere to run...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems the archfiends keep only those who are fit for battle. Others must escape or be consumed.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04593D
dialogue.text: Obey or be eaten. Obey but eventually be eaten anyway. I don't want to live like that...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Oh, you've finished already? Or did we get carried away talking...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: There's no easy way to mark the passage of time in this world. Nor do I imagine such things concern voidsent.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It would take considerable mental fortitude to still care after millennia in this endless night.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: No trouble on your end either? Good.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I daresay Scarmiglione's fate served as sufficient warning. Let's hope that those elsewhere have the same sense.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Is there no end to their questions? <sigh> I should've demanded more aether...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Were you able to learn aught of value?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: So countless voidsent answer to the archfiends, who in turn answer to Golbez─as your vision did suggest.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Scarmiglione's aggression is also consistent with the claims that the archfiends conquer other domains.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The question is, how do we reach Golbez if he surrounds himself with armies of minions?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We could target his other archfiends...or perhaps those who have fled his service. Either may yield useful information.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: That said, we can't do much while we're stuck on this isle.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Zero, I would ask a favor of you.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I am determined to save my sister Azdaja. If there is even a faint possibility that Golbez has her, then I must find him.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: To that end, I want you to lend us your strength and knowledge. Will you accompany us on our quest?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Forgotten the way of my world already? If you want help, offer payment.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: None here will aid you out of the kindness of their hearts. Any who claim otherwise are liars and betrayers.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Or is this less a request and more a threat? If I refuse, will you force me to serve?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If you accompany us, we can offer you protection.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Surely you must desire something. Name it.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: We're not like Zenos. We would never, ever force you to serve.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Protection? I have no need of such.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I was a prisoner, yes, but only because I couldn't be bothered to resist. I could have easily broken free had I desired to do so.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: If you're truly such an aimless creature, then you could do worse than to join us. You needn't expend as much energy to defend yourself as you would alone.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Trying to be clever, are you? But even if you had a point, your protection isn't enough to persuade me.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I have no purpose. Why would I desire anything?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: That's why I didn't bother to resist when the ones here fell upon me. What matters in a world that's already dead?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: By that logic, you've no reason to refuse our requests. The payment need but be to your satisfaction, correct?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: <sigh> Did I not already say as much from the start?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: You aren't forcing your avatar to serve against its will, that's true. Yours is an equitable covenant.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: That being the case, I can believe your words. You would provide fair payment.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: ...Well? What do you offer?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Very well, Zero. I propose you travel with us, and whenever you perform a deed that requires payment, we will provide it in aether.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: That's all you had to say. Everything else was superfluous.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Fair point. Where to now?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Either a place the archfiends may strike next, or where refugees and deserters may seek sanctuary...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I know the latter. I'll take you there.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I assume you also know how we can get off this isle?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I was brought here on a mount. We can leave the same way.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, I did notice some flying creatures near the terraces.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Given our numbers, we'll need a large one. But regardless of size, all can be won over with aether.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Excellent. Let us go and find our mount at once.

dialogue.name: SPYVOIDSENT
dialogue.text: (-Snooping Voidsent-)Not good... Lord Golbez must hear of this!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Zero will best know how to handle the creatures. Let us watch and learn.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Not all voidsent can fly. It stands to reason that some would be made to serve as mounts.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Were I here in my true form, I would be able to carry you all. But even were it possible to so enlarge the gate, the risk would be too great.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: We should be able to find a mount here. With the castle in disarray, the creatures will be hungry. Just a little aether should suffice.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Are you ready?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Leave Troia Keep?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: 'Tis said that a person's domain is a reflection of what abides in their heart. If true, this place may offer a glimpse into Zero's past.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The longer one lives, the more one yearns for peace. I understand why some would sequester themselves here.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: 'Tis quite a gathering of voidsent. I pray one among them has the knowledge we seek.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: This is my abode. The others won't come near, so you may be at ease.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: While they know their place, if tantalizing aether were to walk by, I can't guarantee they wouldn't pounce.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: It is a voidsent's nature to consume. Their sole purpose. Even if the pursuit of aether may lead to their undoing, many succumb to instinct.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: But any who succumb here will have to answer to me. This is my domain's one and only rule─and it is absolute.
